page.title: 17LIMERIGG WATER SKIING 1
page.content: Water skiing began in Scotland at Black Loch,Limerigg,Slamannan. This sport started in 1953 when Dr.Ian Arthur brought his speedboat back from the South of France. The sport was later taken up at Lochearnhead and other lochs throughout Scotland,but the centre for advanced skiing and for the main water ski competitions in Scotland is at the Black Loch. The Scottish overall water ski champion is John Arthur who has held the title for 12 years. Melanie Chambers,who holds the woman's title,is also a a member of the Slamannan Water Ski Club. Other members of the Scottish team ski at the Black Loch. The club has the use of 4 Boesch ski boats which are specially designed for water skiing. These boats are fitted with 260 b.h.p.engines which are necessary to maintain a steady pull.
